page.title: 01Lundy Island-the South.
page.content: Lundy Island falls into 3 D blocks. For reasons of convienience and space all those things that relate to the ecology of the island are dealt with in the north,as are the children's experiences. Likewise the history of the island and information regarding tourism are dealt with in the south. The central block contains the main settlement. Lundy lies 11 miles off the North Devon coast.It is owned by the National Trust and run by the Landmark Trust.It has a small resident population and its main industry is tourism-with some farming.The island has its own supply ship and a weekly helicopter service. Although only 3 miles long and about half a mile wide the island has a wealth of interest- and the scenery and peace are magnificent.
